tests.description: Test the SRL system's ability to distinguish between statements and questions and identify the semantic roles of the arguments in basic sentence structures.

inputs.sentence: Did the cat chase the mouse?

tests.description: Test the SRL system's ability to distinguish between statements and questions and identify the semantic roles of the arguments in an ambiguous proposition.

inputs.sentence: The teacher asked the student a question.
Did the teacher ask the student a question?

tests.description: Test the SRL system's ability to distinguish between statements and questions and identify the semantic roles of the arguments in complex sentence structures.

inputs.sentence: The police arrested the suspect at the scene of the crime.
Did the police arrest the suspect at the scene of the crime?

tests.description: Test the SRL system's ability to distinguish between active and passive voice and identify the semantic roles of the arguments.

inputs.sentence: Was the meal cooked by the chef?

tests.description: Test the SRL system's ability to handle complex clauses and identify the semantic roles of the arguments.

inputs.sentence: The company hired a new CEO, who plans to implement new policies.
Did the company hire a new CEO, who plans to implement new policies?

tests.description: Test the SRL system's ability to handle multiple clauses and identify the semantic roles of the arguments.

inputs.sentence: The doctor gave me a prescription for medication, which I filled at the pharmacy, and now I feel much better.
Did the doctor give you a prescription for medication, which you filled at the pharmacy, and now you feel much better?

tests.description: Test the SRL system's ability to distinguish between statements and questions and identify the semantic roles of the arguments in sentences with passive voice.

inputs.sentence: The cake was baked by the chef.
Was the cake baked by the chef?

tests.description: Test the SRL system's ability to distinguish between statements and questions and identify the semantic roles of the arguments in sentences with elliptical clauses.

inputs.sentence: She can play the guitar better than he can.
